original: Friedmann, Semmy, skådespelare, Göteborg, f. 14/9/91 i Kristianstad av Simon F. o. Clara Ritlevsky. G. 30 m. skådesp. Wanda Rothgardt. Barn: Jane f. 31. — Dram. teaterns ekv-s,k. 11-13. Erh. Anders de Wahl-stip. Anst. i Helsingfors 13-15, Sthlm 15-17, v. Lorensbergsteatern i Gbg 17-29, v. Dramat, teatern 31-36, v. Gbgs stadsteater sed. 36. Bli. roll.: Prinsen i Det var en gång. Sonen i Pelikan, Felix i Kvinnan på 40 år, Lill-Klas, Aladdin, Martin Luther i Näk-tergalkn i Wittenberg, Horkay i Flickorna Gyurkovics, Doktor Knock, Marcel i Tre o. en, Loving i Dagar utan mål, Jacobow^sky i Jacobowsky o. översten. Medv. i bl. a. filmerna Pettersson o. Bendel, Simon i Backabo, Kungen kommer. Flickorna på Upp-åkra, Hans nåds testamente. Folket i Simlångsdalen.
translated: Friedmann, Semmy, actor, Gothenburg, born on September 14, 1891 in Kristianstad to Simon F. and Clara Ritlevsky. Married in 1930 to actress Wanda Rothgardt. They have one child, Jane, born in 1931. Semmy worked at Dramatic Theater in Stockholm from 1911-1913, received the Anders de Wahl scholarship and worked in Helsinki from 1913-1915, Stockholm from 1915-1917, Lorensbergsteatern in Gothenburg from 1917-1929, Dramaten from 1931-1936 and then at Gothenburg City Theater from 1936 onwards. Some of his notable roles were Prince in Once upon a time, Son in Pelikan, Felix in Woman at 40, Lill-Klas, Aladdin, Martin Luther in Nightingale Can Sing in Wittenberg, Horkay in The Gyurkovics Girls, Dr. Knock, Marcel in Three and One, Loving in Days without destination, Jacobowsky in Jacobowsky and the Colonel. He also appeared in films such as Pettersson and Bendel, Simon in Backabo, The King is coming, The Girls of Uppåkra, His Lordship's Will and People in Simlångsdalen.
